intro: Rubus eminens, commonly known as the alpine raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, often branched stems covered in dense, stinging hairs. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin. Rubus eminens thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
